subject: Career
title: Remote Culture: Intentional, Not Accidental
description: Learn Remote Culture: Intentional, Not Accidental in one minute.

hook.text: Office culture happens in hallways and coffee runs. Remote culture doesn't happen unless you build it.

buildup.text: In offices, culture forms organically through proximity. Remote teams need deliberate cultural rituals.

discovery.text: Automattic (WordPress) uses text-based 'water coolers,' team meetups, and a public internal blog for culture.

twist.text: Forced fun backfires. Virtual happy hours feel like extra meetings. Opt-in, low-pressure events work better.

climax.text: Create rituals: Monday wins, Friday show-and-tell, async social channels, and annual in-person retreats.

punchline.text: Remote culture must be designed. It won't build itself.

quiz.question: Why does remote culture need deliberate design?
options: It doesn't form organically through proximity like office culture
Remote workers don't care about culture
